welcome.about_description: Hello üëã, my name is Matheus, which means something close to "Gift given by God" in Portuguese. Married, father of a little angel, Software Engineer, musician, passionate about teaching and minimalist, and who lives in the city of Manaus - Amazonas, Brazil.
welcome.image_alt_github: Banner with a white background highlighting the phrase 'www.matheusscode.com' and the description: 'Follow my journey as a Software Engineer and Architect. Explore my personal projects and blog posts.'
welcome.congratulations: I worked on them all with all the affection and gratitude in the world.
welcome.ham_table_office: Full Stack Engineer and Systems Analyst

stack.javascript: A widely used programming language for web development, enabling the creation of dynamic and interactive websites.
stack.typescript: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, making error detection and code maintenance easier.
stack.dart: A programming language optimized for mobile app development with the Flutter framework. (Studying)
stack.python: A versatile programming language with clear syntax, used for a wide range of applications, from simple scripts to complex systems. (Studying)
stack.rust: A programming language focused on safety and performance, with modern and efficient syntax. (Studying)
stack.next_js: A React framework that facilitates building static and dynamic web applications with server-side rendering capabilities.
stack.react_js: A JavaScript library for building interactive and reusable user interfaces in web applications.
stack.react_native: A JavaScript-based framework that allows for building native mobile apps using React.
stack.svelte: A JavaScript framework for building user interfaces with a reactive approach, generating optimized code at compile time.
stack.tailwind_css: A utility-first CSS framework that allows for creating custom designs with style classes.
stack.material_tailwind: A CSS framework that combines Material Design principles with Tailwind CSS utilities to create visually appealing interfaces.
stack.styled_components: A library for styling React components using template literals and CSS-in-JS.
stack.stitches: A CSS-in-JS library for styling React applications with a focus on performance and flexibility.
stack.ant_design: A UI component library for React offering a set of components with an elegant and consistent visual style.
stack.shadcn_ui: A UI component library for React designed for modern applications with an intuitive design.
stack.chakra_ui: A UI component library for React based on Material Design principles, focusing on accessibility and simplicity.
stack.material_ui: A UI component library for React promoting accessibility and simplicity, following Material Design guidelines.
stack.radix_ui: A UI component library for React focusing on high quality and accessibility for modern applications.
stack.node_js: An asynchronous JavaScript runtime environment based on Google's V8 engine, used for building server-side applications.
stack.nest_js: A progressive Node.js framework that simplifies building efficient, reliable, and scalable server-side applications.
stack.kita_js: A minimalist JavaScript framework aimed at building RESTful APIs with simplicity and efficiency.
stack.fastify_js: A fast and efficient web framework for Node.js, focused on performance and simplicity in building web servers.
stack.express_js: A minimalist and flexible web framework for Node.js, widely used for building APIs and web applications.
stack.data_dog: A platform for monitoring and performance analysis of applications, providing insights into logs, metrics, and overall system health.
stack.drizzle: A modern and intuitive ORM for Node.js and TypeScript, facilitating data manipulation in relational databases.
stack.prisma: An ORM that simplifies access and manipulation of data in relational and NoSQL databases, with support for TypeScript and JavaScript.
stack.mysql: A relational database management system developed by Oracle, available under a dual license including both open-source and commercial options.
stack.mongodb: A NoSQL document-oriented database that stores data in JSON-like format for greater flexibility.
stack.postgresql: An open-source relational database management system known for its robustness and standards compliance.
stack.firebase: A mobile and web application development platform offering a range of services, including real-time databases and authentication.
stack.vercel: A cloud computing platform that simplifies deployment, scaling, and management of web applications and APIs.
stack.railway: A cloud development platform that streamlines the deployment and management of web applications and databases.
stack.docker: A platform for creating, distributing, and running applications in containers, ensuring consistency across different development environments.
stack.visual_studio_code: A source code editor developed by Microsoft, known for its extensions and support for multiple programming languages.
stack.figma: A browser-based user interface design tool that allows for real-time collaboration.
stack.jira: Project management and issue tracking software.
stack.discord: A communication platform for voice, video, and text, aimed at gamers.
stack.insomnia: A REST client tool for testing APIs and software development.
stack.postman: A collaboration platform for API development used by developers to build, test, and document APIs.
stack.google_meet: A video conferencing platform developed by Google.
stack.microsoft_teams: A collaboration and communication platform developed by Microsoft.
stack.npm: The standard package manager for the Node.js environment.
stack.yarn: A fast, reliable, and secure package manager for JavaScript.
stack.pnpm: A fast and efficient package manager that uses disk space intelligently.
